case_title: INAYATULLAH CHAUDHRY and others vs AZAD JAMMU AND KASHMIR GOVERNMENT through its Chief Secretary and others
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondents: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Government through its Chief Secretary
issues: Determination of seniority of Assistant Engineers (Electricity)
Impact of Public Service Commission recommendations

seniority_determination.criteria: Merit assigned by Public Service Commission

key_findings.ad_hoc_appointments: Ad hoc appointments do not confer rights for seniority under Rule 23 of Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servants Rules 1977.
key_findings.public_service_commission: Appointments made without reference to the Public Service Commission during 1974-1978 were deemed ad hoc unless suitability was later confirmed.

appellants: Claimed seniority based on merit assigned by Public Service Commission.
respondents: Argued continuous service and transfer to equivalent posts did not require Public Service Commission approval.
Defended seniority assignments based on government orders.

legal_references: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servants Rules 1977
Relevant case laws cited: 1987 P L C 144, 1984 SCMR 1023, 1986 P L C 658
notes: No costs awarded. Appeals were decided based on merit and adherence to service rules.
